trans-unit.source: Learn what you can do if you think another app is infringing on your intellectual property rights.
trans-unit.target: Learn what you can do if you think another app is infringing on your intellectual property rights.

trans-unit.source: Trademark and copyright protection
trans-unit.target: Trademark and copyright protection

trans-unit.source: Trademark and copyright protection
trans-unit.target: Trademark and copyright protection

trans-unit.source: Learn what you can do if you think another app is infringing on your intellectual property rights.
trans-unit.target: Learn what you can do if you think another app is infringing on your intellectual property rights.

trans-unit.source: 1. How may I report an infringement of my intellectual property rights within a Windows app?
trans-unit.target: 1. How may I report an infringement of my intellectual property rights within a Windows app?

trans-unit.source: Please use the following [form](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=273879) to submit a copyright, trademark or publicity rights infringement complaint on a Windows app.
trans-unit.target: Please use the following [form](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=273879) to submit a copyright, trademark or publicity rights infringement complaint on a Windows app.

trans-unit.source: For copyright, trademark or publicity rights infringements complaints across multiple apps, please submit your request to mktlegal@microsoft.com.
trans-unit.target: For copyright, trademark or publicity rights infringements complaints across multiple apps, please submit your request to mktlegal@microsoft.com.

trans-unit.source: If you need additional info about Microsoft’s DMCA policy, please visit: [https://www.microsoft.com/info/cpyrtInfrg.aspx](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=626976).
trans-unit.target: If you need additional info about Microsoft’s DMCA policy, please visit: [https://www.microsoft.com/info/cpyrtInfrg.aspx](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=626976).

trans-unit.source: 2. I created my app to work with a Microsoft product/service.
trans-unit.target: 2. I created my app to work with a Microsoft product/service.

trans-unit.source: May I use the Microsoft product/service name in the name of my app?
trans-unit.target: May I use the Microsoft product/service name in the name of my app?

trans-unit.source: Microsoft strongly prefers that you do not.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft strongly prefers that you do not.

trans-unit.source: But if there is a clear business necessity, you may do so if you follow these guidelines:
trans-unit.target: But if there is a clear business necessity, you may do so if you follow these guidelines:

trans-unit.source: The name of your app should not begin with the Microsoft product or service name at issue.
trans-unit.target: The name of your app should not begin with the Microsoft product or service name at issue.

trans-unit.source: For example, "Xbox Points Calculator" should not be used as an app name.
trans-unit.target: For example, "Xbox Points Calculator" should not be used as an app name.

trans-unit.source: "Bob’s Points Calculator for Xbox" is a better name.
trans-unit.target: "Bob’s Points Calculator for Xbox" is a better name.

trans-unit.source: This makes it clear that the app is not distributed by Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: This makes it clear that the app is not distributed by Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Use language that explains that your app was designed to work in conjunction with a Microsoft product or service.
trans-unit.target: Use language that explains that your app was designed to work in conjunction with a Microsoft product or service.

trans-unit.source: For example, "works with," "for," "designed for," and "optimized for" are all acceptable terms to explain that your product is designed to work in conjunction with a Microsoft product or service.
trans-unit.target: For example, "works with," "for," "designed for," and "optimized for" are all acceptable terms to explain that your product is designed to work in conjunction with a Microsoft product or service.

trans-unit.source: Use of terms such as "certified," "official," "authentic," and "licensed" imply legal affiliation or overt endorsement and thus must not be used absent a formal trademark license agreement with Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Use of terms such as "certified," "official," "authentic," and "licensed" imply legal affiliation or overt endorsement and thus must not be used absent a formal trademark license agreement with Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Such agreements are typically not available in this context.
trans-unit.target: Such agreements are typically not available in this context.

trans-unit.source: Use the Microsoft product/service name only in plain text.
trans-unit.target: Use the Microsoft product/service name only in plain text.

trans-unit.source: Do not use any fancy fonts or accompanying graphics.
trans-unit.target: Do not use any fancy fonts or accompanying graphics.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [General Microsoft Trademark Guidelines](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=225434).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [General Microsoft Trademark Guidelines](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=225434).

trans-unit.source: 3. Is it OK if I use the trademarked name or logo of another company in the title of my app or as part of the content of my app?
trans-unit.target: 3. Is it OK if I use the trademarked name or logo of another company in the title of my app or as part of the content of my app?

trans-unit.source: You need to consult your own trademark counsel about the use of a trademarked name or logo of another company.
trans-unit.target: You need to consult your own trademark counsel about the use of a trademarked name or logo of another company.

trans-unit.source: However, Microsoft will take apps off the Store upon proper notice from trademark owners regarding misuse of their trademarks.
trans-unit.target: However, Microsoft will take apps off the Store upon proper notice from trademark owners regarding misuse of their trademarks.

trans-unit.source: Accordingly, we strongly urge you to exercise adequate due diligence.
trans-unit.target: Accordingly, we strongly urge you to exercise adequate due diligence.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [U.S. Patent and Trademark Office: Trademark Basics](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=225271).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [U.S. Patent and Trademark Office: Trademark Basics](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=225271).

trans-unit.source: 4. May I use Microsoft’s graphical trademarks (logos), such as the WINDOWS FLAG logo, in my app?
trans-unit.target: 4. May I use Microsoft’s graphical trademarks (logos), such as the WINDOWS FLAG logo, in my app?

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft allows third parties to use its trademarked logos only via formal license.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft allows third parties to use its trademarked logos only via formal license.

trans-unit.source: Such a license is typically not available in this context.
trans-unit.target: Such a license is typically not available in this context.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [U.S. Patent and Trademark Office: Trademark Basics](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=225271) or download [U.S. Copyright Office: Copyright Basics](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=225273).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [U.S. Patent and Trademark Office: Trademark Basics](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=225271) or download [U.S. Copyright Office: Copyright Basics](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=225273).

trans-unit.source: 5. Do I need to use registered ® or trademark ™ symbols when I refer to a Microsoft trademark in my app?
trans-unit.target: 5. Do I need to use registered ® or trademark ™ symbols when I refer to a Microsoft trademark in my app?

trans-unit.source: And must I, when using a Microsoft trademark, place a trademark attribution notice in my app, for example, "Microsoft is a registered trademark of the Microsoft Corporation"?
trans-unit.target: And must I, when using a Microsoft trademark, place a trademark attribution notice in my app, for example, "Microsoft is a registered trademark of the Microsoft Corporation"?

trans-unit.source: There is no legal requirement that you include these symbols or the attribution notice, but Microsoft would greatly appreciate it if you do.
trans-unit.target: There is no legal requirement that you include these symbols or the attribution notice, but Microsoft would greatly appreciate it if you do.

trans-unit.source: 6. Is it OK if I make a game that is identical to someone else’s game as long as I change the name?
trans-unit.target: 6. Is it OK if I make a game that is identical to someone else’s game as long as I change the name?

trans-unit.source: No, not without permission.
trans-unit.target: No, not without permission.

trans-unit.source: While copyright does not protect the idea of a game, it does protect original expression in a game, such as original audiovisual elements, graphics, sounds, characters, and so on, and the original selection and arrangement of these elements.
trans-unit.target: While copyright does not protect the idea of a game, it does protect original expression in a game, such as original audiovisual elements, graphics, sounds, characters, and so on, and the original selection and arrangement of these elements.

trans-unit.source: A game that is too similar to someone else’s game could subject you to a claim of copyright infringement.
trans-unit.target: A game that is too similar to someone else’s game could subject you to a claim of copyright infringement.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft cannot give advice on this issue, and you may need to consult your own lawyer if you are unsure about whether your game is too similar.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft cannot give advice on this issue, and you may need to consult your own lawyer if you are unsure about whether your game is too similar.

trans-unit.source: For more information, download [U.S. Copyright Office: Copyright Basics](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=225273).
trans-unit.target: For more information, download [U.S. Copyright Office: Copyright Basics](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=225273).

trans-unit.source: 7. What should I do if I get a notice from Microsoft telling me it has received a complaint that my app infringes a trademark or copyright?
trans-unit.target: 7. What should I do if I get a notice from Microsoft telling me it has received a complaint that my app infringes a trademark or copyright?

trans-unit.source: Read the notice from Microsoft carefully, and follow the instructions.
trans-unit.target: Read the notice from Microsoft carefully, and follow the instructions.

trans-unit.source: The notice from Microsoft may include specific steps you may follow to inform us what you have done to correct the problem, that you disagree with the claimant, and/or that you want to resubmit your app to the Store.
trans-unit.target: The notice from Microsoft may include specific steps you may follow to inform us what you have done to correct the problem, that you disagree with the claimant, and/or that you want to resubmit your app to the Store.
